ShardHost – £13/Year ($20~) 256MB SSD KVM VPS in Dallas, Texas or Buffalo, NY

September 25, 2013 @ 5:19 pm, by Liam

NOTICE: ShardHost has closed down with a one-hour notice to customers before starting to shut down servers. The reason for this is unknown.

Marc, from ShardHost, recently wrote in to share a couple of their new SSD specials, completely different from their last offer. These are LET/LEB exclusive and have not been advertised anywhere else.

Specials – KVMSSDANNUAL

  • 256MB RAM
  • 256MB Swap
  • 1 vCPU Core
  • 3.75GB RAID10 SSD Diskspace
  • 512GB Bandwidth
  • KVM/SolusVM
  • 1 IPv4 Address
  • 1Gbps Port Speed
  • £12.90/Year ($20~) | Order Link
Specials – KVMSSDMONTHLY

  • 1024MB RAM
  • 1024MB Swap
  • 3 vCPU Cores
  • 15GB RAID10 SSD Diskspace
  • 2048GB Bandwidth
  • KVM/SolusVM
  • 1 IPv4 Address
  • 1Gbps Port Speed
  • £4.51/Month ($7~)| Order Link

ShardHost have been featured on LowEndBox twice before. Marc tells us that on their last offer, they were inundated with signups, picking up nearly “1000 happy clients” as a result of being featured on here. They’re using Supermicro Servers with the Intel E3 1240v3 and 6 x Intel 520 SSDs with the Raid 10 LSI 9271 8i with Cachevault. The infamous DD test is apparently pushing 1.4-1.5 GB/s! These servers are owned by shard host and colocated with Colocrossing. ShardHost is a registered UK company (reg 07679837), who have been in business since June 2011. Reviews on their previous posts have been pretty decent.

ShardHost accept payments via Paypal or Debit/Credit card (Stripe). They offer a 7 day moneyback guarantee. EU clients will be liable for VAT charged @ 20% (GB136446902). Plans come with one IPv4, additional IPv4 are $1/mo. IPv6 is not currently available. They can double/triple resources on these plan for double/triple the price, simply open a ticket after ordering. To summarise their Terms of Service: Be a good neighbour, No spam/abuse, Legal stored content only and finally No TOR. For more information, have a read of their Terms of Service and their Acceptable Usage Policy.
